right_answer: burning chest pain with palpable acute hyperventilation. She developed substernal burning chest pain approximately 5 hours before my exam, associated with lightheadedness, numbness and tingling of fingers, and does admit to hyperventilation.

right_answer: vital signs: stable. Constitutional: healthy-appearing 20-year-old female. Head and eyes: negative. ENT, mouth, and neck: negative. Asymptomatic at this time.

right_answer: renal function and electrolytes are normal. White count 8500, hemoglobin 12.6, and platelets normal. Troponin negative. D-dimer negative.

right_answer: the patient appears to be medically stable. At the point of disposition, she highlights that she has actually been seen in for stress test this morning.
